title: Senior Event Marketing Specialist - International Events (English & German bilingual)
content:
About OpenTable
With millions of diners, tens of thousands of restaurants, and 23+ years of experience, OpenTable, part of Booking Holdings, Inc. (NASDAQ: BKNG), is an industry leader with a unique insight into the world of hospitality. We champion restaurants, bars, wineries, and other venues around the world, helping them attract guests, manage capacity, improve operations and increase revenue.
Every employee at OpenTable has a tangible impact on what we do and how we do it. Join a global network that includes OpenTable and KAYAK's portfolio of travel brands including Swoodoo, checkfelix, momondo, Cheapflights, Mundi and HotelsCombined.
Hospitality is all about looking after others. You’ll work in a welcoming environment, and get the benefits and flexibility to succeed.
The Position
We are seeking a bilingual (English & German) hardworking and dedicated Senior Marketing Specialist to work on all aspects of and implement multi-faceted events for OpenTable across our international markets with focus on EMEA, Mexico, and Canada. 
The ideal candidate has at least 5+years experience working in industry-facing (B2B) events, integrated B2C events, has a strong track record of crafting unforgettable experiences for the audience and can get going quickly. 
This person should have a passion for the dining scene and get excited to craft and execute experiences that will get both restaurants and diners excited about OpenTable and its network, including customer dinners, thought leadership series, trade shows, sponsorships and diner facing events like special experiences and food festivals. 
People skills and passion for building relationships with our partners, suppliers, customers and internally within OpenTable are of paramount importance. 
In this role, you will:

Report to and working closely with the Senior Marketing Manager you will also partner with our wider team to cultivate strong influencer relationships
Support in the creation of industry event experiences, content, marketing materials, branded giveaways and hospitality initiatives to solidify OpenTable’s role as a trusted and valued partner within the restaurant community. 
Initiate and develop industry-facing (B2B) events and integrated B2C events to increase brand awareness and create positive brand perception among restaurateurs and diners
Develop scalable and creative tactics in generating sales leads from B2B events, and conversions (bookings, app installs, etc.) through B2C events
Be prepared to roll your sleeves up for hands-on execution work with event venues and production companies in the run up to and during the events.
This role offers the opportunity to help drive a world-class events marketing strategy for the world’s leading restaurant reservations provider within collaborative teams across international markets.

Requirements

BA/BS degree required
5+ years of event management experience
A tenacious self-starter who will waste no time
Fluency / full working proficiency in German language is a requirement, any further language is a bonus
Experience exhibiting at trade shows is a strong plus 
A passion for the restaurant industry, ideally paired with knowledge and understanding of it is of advantage
Strong communication skills as this role will interface regularly with diverse and cross-functional internal and external team members
Collaborative individual who enjoys participating in cross-functional and global teams
Comfortable with a wide variety of technologies and ability to learn quickly
Superior project management skills; results focus with superb execution and follow-through
Meticulous attention to detail and highly-organized with the ability to identify roadblocks and troubleshoot efficiently and effectively
Comfortable working against hard deadlines and multitask, with “no job is too small or too big” attitude
Comfort with data, numbers, budgets and focus on return on investment measurement; experience with Salesforce is a plus
Able and eager to travel to run and attend events and team meetings/offsites
A sense of humor and positive outlook to fit in with our strong performing team is a plus!

Benefits:


Vacation: you will accrue 25 vacation days per year in addition to statutory UK Bank Holidays


One Celebration Day per calendar year


Private Health & Dental and Life Insurances


Employee Assistance Program (EAP)


Pension Fund


Gym Discount


Bike2Work


Season Loan Ticket


Reimbursable eye tests and 100 GBP contribution towards VDU glasses only


Perkbox & Booking.com business discounts


Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
OpenTable aspires to be a workplace that reflects the diverse communities we serve and a culture that is inclusive and welcoming. Hiring people with different backgrounds, experiences, perspectives, and ideas is critical to innovation and to how we deliver great experiences for our users and our partners. Representation matters.
We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform job responsibilities, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

questions.label: How did you hear about this job?

questions.description: KAYAK Software Corporation, OpenTable, Inc., their respective subsidiaries and Momondo A/S (together, ‘KAYAK and OpenTable”, “our/we/us”, or “Company”) will process your personal data in accordance with applicable data protection laws for the purposes described in our privacy notice (Germany and All Other Locations). As part of the application process KAYAK and/or OpenTable may share your personal data across our group of companies, subject to our privacy notice and applicable laws.  In order to consider you for new positions, KAYAK and/or OpenTable may keep your personal data for 6 months (within the EU) and 2 years (in all other regions), unless otherwise required by applicable law.
